page.title: 06 CHAMBERCOMBE
page.content: This is a very old part of Ilfracombe and was mentioned in the first Domesday Book.It takes its name from an owner of Chambercombe Manor called Sir Henry Champernon.Once this area was all farmland,but as Ilfracombe became more popular as a seaside resort,it developed into a residential area and is still developing.The children are very noisy and play in the street.This disturbs the old age pensioners who have lived in these parts a long time.The roads are packed with parked cars as most of the houses do not have garages.The dustbin bags are put out on Thursday night,by Friday morning the rubbish is all over the place,because the bags have been ripped up by cats,dogs and seagulls. There is a garage where cars and trucks are mended.The fumes from it are terrible.
